    • Constructor Detail

      • GSOMArray

        public GSOMArray(int dimension,
         int iteration,
         double learningRate,
         double radius,
         java.lang.String inputVectors,
         DisplayLattice screen)
        Parameters:
        dimension - as the dimensionality of the input vector
        iteration - as the number of iterations per input vector
        learningRate - as the learning rate
        radius - as the effective area of weight adjustment
        inputVectors - as the set of input vectors
        screen - as the JPanel used for producing the visual output This the only constructor of the GSOMArray class. This constructor initializes all the basic variable values and sets up the basic four node GSOM structure. The basic GSOM array is 71 x 71 with a offset of 35. So the 0,0 element of the GSOM is placed in the 0+offset,0+offset location. When accessing elements and adjusting them the offset has to be used. The array could be expanded to a larger array if the map growth exceeds the basic allocation. The offset variable has to be recalculated each time.
